<RESUME_START>
DIRECTOR OF FINANCE
Professional Summary
Seeking a position in financial/general accounting.
Highly meticulous and reliable Finance Director with an outstanding client service record.
Adept multitasker able to handle a number of cash management projects with professionalism and accuracy.
Strong research skills in optimizing current and efficient cash management team operation.

EXPERIENCE

Director of Finance
May 2016
to
Current
Company Name
— City , State
Manages the day to day accounting department, including hands on monthly close, commission reports, financial statements.
Manages financial tasks, budgeting and overall accounting of the company.
Develop and implement short and long-term financial strategies and tactics in alignment with the company's business plan and strategic initiatives.
Develop and monitor policies and procedures within generally accepted accounting principles and corporate guidelines to ensure sufficient cash flow, reduced operating cost, and increased revenues.
Forecast, monitor performance and prepare analytical information and management reports to enable effective decision making by the CEO.
Manage and develop clear and precise financial records, analyze financial statement while ensuring the integrity of all financials, and maintain internal control.
Manages monthly and yearly closing responsibilities including system closing, journal entry preparation and inventory reconciliation.
Prepare and review all documentation required to meet reporting deadlines.
Provide financial reports and analysis to Executive Staff.
Serve as primary liaison to outside CPA firm for assurance and income tax preparation services.

Evaluate confirms and trades for settlements.
Prepares Cash and Portfolio Reconciliations for equities and fixed income.
Performs daily and monthly analysis and quarterly reporting for institutional investors.
Communicates daily with custodians and prime brokers to resolve trading, operational and accounting issues.
Prepares financial statement for the funds and participate in other Ad Hoc projects as needed.

Performs a variety of routine accounting functions in accordance with United States Generally Accepted Accounting Principles and Sarbanes Oxley Act.
Prepares financial statement reconciliation report, by analyzing general ledger activity and propose appropriate adjusting entries.
Assists with audits by providing supporting records and documentation.
Prepares, reviews and verifies the accuracy of journal entries and accounting classifications assigned to various records.

Assists in the documentation of processes and establishment of internal controls.
I do evaluate the effectiveness and efficiency of business processes, procedures and accounting assumptions on an ongoing basis.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Staff Accountant

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance

Description:
FlexTrades, a growing, fast-paced, and entrepreneurial company, is the nation’s leading provider of production solutions. We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Staff Accountant to join our finance team. The Staff Accountant will be responsible for assisting with various financial tasks, including but not limited to preparing and examining financial records, reconciling accounts, regulatory compliance, and ensuring compliance with relevant accounting standards. A person who is internally driven to achieve and interested in a wide range of experience will continue to be challenged and be successful in this role. ResponsibilitiesReview and record accounting transactions on a daily, weekly and monthly basis to support business analysis in real time Generate weekly and monthly financial reports to support business analysis Assist with month-end close including preparation of account analysis and reconciliationsReview and record corporate credit card transactionsAssist with ensuring tax and regulatory compliance i.e. preparing business registrations, filing annual reports, researching notices from taxing entities, etc.Cross train to perform as a backup for payroll, accounts payable, and cash receiptsIdentify opportunities for process improvements and efficiency enhancements within the finance departmentAssist with the implementation of additional software and/or accounting modules as needed, including design, testing and documentation of new processesAct as a FlexTrades Core Values champion, by Moving the Line, Being the Next, Elevating Others, Pulling the Wagon, Enjoying the Journey, and Giving BackAll other duties as assigned
QualificationsBachelor’s Degree in Accounting or related field with relevant experience.Minimum 3 years progressively responsible financial operations experience.Solid understanding of GAAP requirements and financial principles.Intermediate computer skills with a focus on Microsoft Excel and accounting software packagesExcellent attention to detail and analytical skills.Strong communication and teamwork skills.Proven ability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.High level of integrity and ethical standardsBullhorn and Sage Intacct experience preferred.
Compensation and Benefits Package:Competitive salaryBest in Class: Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability and Life Insurance coverage offeredWork remotely in the United StatesPaid holidays, Vacation, & Birthday PTOCompany sponsored personal wellness planHome office equipment provided

Experience Level (if available): Associate
<JD_END>
